avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: The remaining snow patches will continue to slowly thaw and will be well consolidated. Limited in nature, these can be mainly found on North-East to East aspects above 1000 metres.  Coire rims, deep gullies, gully tops and scarp slopes most affected.  There is currently insufficient snow to warrant an avalanche forecast and no forecast will be published until conditions change.  Information on mountain conditions can be found on the SAIS Northern Cairngorms blog.
avalancheActivity.highlights: NC for 18.01 Limited snow patches remain in mainly NE and  E aspects above 1000m. Insufficient snow to warrant avalanche forecast.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: The mild South-Westerly flow will continue with freezing levels remaining above summits.  A dry day is expected with very strong summit winds.
Observed Weather Influences: A dry and mild day with the freezing levels remaining above the summits.  Bright spells developed later in the afternoon.  Very strong South-Westerly winds throughout.
ObservedSnowStability: The remaining snow patches continue to slowly thaw and are well consolidated.  These can be mainly found on North-East to East aspects above 1000 metres.  Coire rims, deep gullies and scarp slopes most affected.  The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
avalancheActivity.highlights: LO for 18.1: Insufficient snow, no avalanche reports published until conditions change. Refer to blog for mountain information.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Continuing mild and dry with the freezing level above the summits. Strong South-Easterly winds.
Observed Weather Influences: 
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Little change. The snow patches will continue to thaw and diminish. Greatest amounts are in the main Cairngorms, generally around corrie rims and other wind sheltered locations on South-East to South-West aspects above 900 metres. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: SC 18.1.25 Patchy wet snow, mainly sheltered areas in the main Cairngorms. Avalanche hazard Low.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: A dry day is forecast. Freezing levels will remain above the summits but it may feel marginally cooler than of late. Gale force winds throughout, South or South-South-Westerly in direction.
Observed Weather Influences: Another dry and mild day. Freezing levels remained above the summits. Winds were very strong overnight but eased from late morning to become moderate South-South-Westerlies.
ObservedSnowStability: The patchy snow cover is wet but well bonded and stable. Greatest amounts are found mostly around corrie rims and sheltered locations above 900 metres on South-East to South-West aspects. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. Information on mountain conditions can be found on the SAIS Creag Meagaidh blog.
